TopicTitle: Is the green light on the BatPack battery supposed to be yellow under a condition?

Articles.Content: Ever since I got finished up my space station, I've noticed that the battery pack's lights are yellow. I'm not sure if this is to indicate lag (since the station is laggy), if it's a bug as a result of lag, or what. Does anyone know?
I know the clock turns yellow instead of green when low framerate arrives, maybe it has something to do with that?

I dunno, maybe a mod your using could be doing that?

Are you using mods?
I haven't noticed that with my space station.
It was originally supposed to change color with charge but there were more important things to do and it was left behind. Not sure what could be causing it in your case...

I think this happens when a light is shining on the LED of the battery pack. It's happened to me and I thought it was changing colour too because the change was sudden. Alas, it's just being lit up externally, brightening the colour. Oh well.

different lamp colors would be interesting to.

i attach small batteries because of the green light...

didnt notice any other color

I dunno, maybe a mod your using could be doing that?

Are you using mods?

Nope, un-modded game.

I think this happens when a light is shining on the LED of the battery pack. It's happened to me and I thought it was changing colour too because the change was sudden. Alas, it's just being lit up externally, brightening the colour. Oh well.

That turned out to be the case, because I turned off all the LED's, and once the light was COMPLETELY gone, it turned green. It's still weird though, because it's not like the light is overpowering the battery, since the color change is instantaneous, and not a continuous change as the LED's dissipate.

It's still weird though

KSP lighting in a nutshell.
